- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

On Windows Server 2016 install PowerShell 7.2.2 or 7.2.4 with option "Add 'Open here' context menus for Explorer"

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12291869/168981552-2764c0d4-be59-45f7-a199-c14e513df6a0.png)

From explorer shortcut on taskbar right click and choose a folder from frequent. It opens in PowerShell instead of Explorer.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12291869/168982076-b76325f9-d0b1-46c4-aff3-346338ba1461.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12291869/168982179-b0f711c9-8099-4d52-aeec-3fa5a5c293a7.png)

In Windows 10 I do not experience such behavior and works as expected.

### Expected behavior

```console
Explorer shortcut should open in explorer on Windows 2016.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
The explorer shortcut opens in PowerShell console.
```
